alert.note: Alert for Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 15 at 1:22AM AKST until February 15 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Blowing and drifting snow with reduced visibility. West winds gusting to 35 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Wind chills to 30 below. * WHERE...Upper Koyukuk Valley over Dalton Highway Summits. * WHEN...Until noon AKST today. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult over Dalton Highway Summits. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Snow drifts will form. The wind chills to 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East winds gusting to 35 mph will cause blowing and drifting snow over Dalton Highway Summits making travel difficult. Wind chills to 30 below will occur. Conditions over summits are expected to improve Wednesday morning as winds decrease. Winds will remain much less in valley locations.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
